title: After loss to Warren, Republican John Deaton announces another run for Senate
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Republican John Deaton announces candidacy for Sen. Ed Markey's seat after previous loss to Elizabeth Warren.
Deaton, 58, criticizes Markey, 80, as a career politician in campaign focused on energy, housing, and independent voice.
Markey faces primary challenge from Rep. Seth Moulton; potential contenders include Rep. Ayanna Pressley.

title: What will the Red Sox target this offseason? Craig Breslow maps out Boston’s priorities.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox aim to acquire a top pitcher to pair with ace Garrett Crochet, potentially via trade or free agency.
Boston is interested in adding power hitters, possibly targeting free agents like Kyle Schwarber or Pete Alonso.
Chief baseball officer Craig Breslow stresses balancing immediate roster improvements with preserving future competitiveness.

title: Zdeno Chara’s 10 most memorable moments with the Bruins
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Zdeno Chara was inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame in 2025, recognizing his impactful career with the Bruins.
Chara was captain of the Boston Bruins for 14 seasons and helped them win the 2011 Stanley Cup.
Chara set a record with a 108.8 mph shot at the 2012 NHL All-Star Game, the hardest in league history.

title: Bill Belichick reflects on ‘learning curve’ during first season coaching college football
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Bill Belichick reflects on his learning curve as North Carolina struggles with a 4-5 record in his first college coaching season.
UNC needs to win 2 of their last 3 games to match last year's 6-win total.
Belichick, former Patriots head coach, discusses adjusting strategies and player positioning throughout the season.

title: Patriots have 15 players land on injury report, but get some good news
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Fifteen New England Patriots players appeared on the injury report before their Thursday game against the New York Jets.
Wide receiver Kayshon Boutte and running back Rhamondre Stevenson were limited participants Monday after missing Sunday's game with injuries.
Tight end Austin Hooper did not participate on Monday due to a concussion suffered in the win over the Buccaneers.

title: Georgia man allegedly stole millions in unclaimed Mass. property
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Shaka Stayman, 44, from Atlanta, accused of stealing over $1.1 million in unclaimed Massachusetts property.
Stayman allegedly submitted false claims and forged documents to Massachusetts's unclaimed property division.
He faces 25 charges and has been held on $2 million cash bail pending federal sentencing in December.

title: TreVeyon Henderson explained why he looked at the sideline during key TD run
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: TreVeyon Henderson scored a decisive TD for the Patriots despite uncertain game clock strategy guidance from the sideline.
Henderson surpassed 100 yards and scored multiple TDs for the first time in his career during the Patriots' win.
With Rhamondre Stevenson sidelined, Henderson's role increased as the Patriots evaluate running back depth amid injuries.

title: Mason Lohrei is latest Bruins player to respond from a Marco Sturm benching
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mason Lohrei returned to the Bruins lineup on Saturday after being a healthy scratch for five games.
Lohrei recorded two assists in a 5-3 victory against Toronto, contributing to a strong defensive performance.
Bruins coach Marco Sturm's lineup changes have effectively motivated players like Lohrei to improve performance.

title: Petitioners gathering signatures to repeal legal marijuana accused of misleading voters
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Petitioners aiming to repeal recreational marijuana in Massachusetts face accusations of misleading voters about the petition's content.
Complaints received by the state mention voters being misled into signing petitions without understanding their purpose.
The Coalition for a Healthy Massachusetts denies supporting deceptive tactics, attributing accusations to the initiative's early success.

title: Massachusetts state payroll hits $9B in 2025 — UMass system dominates
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Massachusetts state payroll reached $9.19 billion in 2025, down from $10.26 billion in 2024, according to state comptroller data.
UMass system had the top 15 highest-paid state employees, with Men's Basketball Head Coach Frank Martin earning $1,955,216.
UMass accounted for $1.55 billion of the state payroll, with MBTA and Trial Court following at $799.68 million and $574.67 million respectively.
